Run For Your Prizetime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou and your friend are participating in a TV show "Run For Your Prize".At the start of the shownprizes are located on a straight line.i-th prize is located at positionai. Positions of all prizes are distinct. You start at position1, your friend — at position106(and there is no prize in any of these two positions). You and another person are participating in a game. There are $n$ prizes located at distinct positions $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$ on a line. You start at position 1 and the other person starts at position 106.  It takes 1 second to move one position to the left or right. You can instantly pick up a prize if you are standing on its position.  

Your goal is to collect all the prizes in the minimum amount of time. You can decide together which prize each person will collect.

What is the minimum time it takes to collect all the prizes?

Two people start at positions 1 and 106 on a line. There are prizes at various positions between them.  They need to collect all the prizes as quickly as possible, moving one position at a time. They can pick up a prize if they are standing on it.  What is the minimum time it takes to collect all the prizes?
